issue.title: Accurate models for Atlas, iRobot and Sandia without adjustments for simulation stability should be available

content.raw:
The latest models (e.g. [irobot hand](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/abda5ce471ae33e67d4b05e73ef316ac0e18438a/irobot_hand_description/urdf/irobot_hand.urdf.xacro?at=default)) do not have any adjustment for simulation stability (well, at least not intended).

@jespersmith Here's a list of models that I am looking at:

 * [Sandia Hand](#!/osrf/sandia-hand/src/default/ros/sandia_hand_description/urdf/sandia_hand.urdf.xacro?at=default)
 * [iRobot Hand](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/default/irobot_hand_description/urdf/irobot_hand.urdf.xacro?at=default)
 * [Atlas V3](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/default/atlas_description/urdf/atlas_v3.urdf?at=default)
 * [MultiSense SL](#!/osrf/drcsim/src/default/multisense_sl_description/urdf/multisense_sl_v3.urdf?at=default) (Thanks @Stefan_Kohlbrecher for pointing that out in #397).
content.html:
The latest models (e.g. irobot hand) do not have any adjustment for simulation stability (well, at least not intended).

@jespersmith Here's a list of models that I am looking at:

  • Sandia Hand
  • iRobot Hand
  • Atlas V3
  • MultiSense SL (Thanks @Stefan_Kohlbrecher for pointing that out in #397).
